title: Teen girl who 'stabbed cat 20 times' got pet from RSPCA just a week earlier
text:
Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

A teenage girl has been accused of torturing a cat which she adopted from the RSPCA just a week before.

Celina Paige Shead was in court to face charges of animal torture and cruelty, after the pet was stabbed at least 20 times.

She appeared at Manly Local Court in Sydney, Australia and wasn't given bail.

She was remanded in custody ahead of a trial after magistrate Miranda Moody had concerns about the safety of other animals if she was let out.

The court heard Shead, 19, had allegedly killed and disposed of the cat close to her home on Sydney's northern beaches on Wednesday morning.

Luke Noonan, representing the teen, said Shead's father, who was not present in court due to work commitments, said she was diagnosed with a borderline personality disorder.

The court heard she had obtained the cat and another from the RSPCA on Tuesday, October 15.

The other cat has been returned to the animal welfare charity.

Her case is due to be heard on Friday, November 8.
description: Celina Paige Shead, 19, is accused of torturing, killing and disposing of the cat in Sydney, Australia
